job_title: Medical Coding Specialist in Charleston, WV
pros: The managers and pay are decent. You should definitely never run out of charts. Good for job security. Flexible and understanding with hours.
cons: Sometimes the managers do things like not respond to an email or not read an email all the way through. We haven't had an individual pay raise based on performance in five years, though sometimes we get lucky and get a hospital wide raise. Have to be cross trained on all account types, not allowed to specialize in just one. A remote position can be earned but it's always going to take longer than you're told as the cross training must come first, and there's a rotation for remote coders back into the office once every two months or so. Administration seems kind of shifty.

pros: The current staff still very friendly. The end of your day/ shift
cons: Pretty much everything except the friendly staff. Years ago Thomas was a great place to work. I never minded having to go to work. That impending dread of work the following day after a long weekend never took place. It was a happy place where staff felt important and felt as if they were making a difference instead of just another employee #. Horrible place now. Stay clear

review_title: Well known for being short staffed in nursing
job_title: RN Staff Nurse in Charleston, WV
pros: They offer flexible schedules, have 12 hour or some 8 hour shifts, free parking at one time, 24 hour pharmacist, employer hosted events (ball game, cookout, Halloween party, Christmas dance, etc.), 401K, and a Starbucks onsite.
cons:
Pay is not competitive. 
Employees are charged for parking.  
Employees have to use the hospital for services to use the insurance.  
The hospital is very top heavy with administration with high salaries but seem to always be short staffed in nursing who are responsible for patient safety.  
Very few opportunities for advancement.

pros: Smaller setting, friendly staff and coworkers. Everyone is for the most part friendly. Scheduling is great if you need time off or want to pick up shifts.
cons: Have worked there for a year and can not find any real down side. Just like any other job there are some down sides but nothing that really stands out.

review_title: not sure this is working out
pros: i think thomas memorial needs a lot less managers and a lot more workers
cons: too many patients and not enough nurses.  too many people want to be the boss and not enough want to do their jobs

pros: Company has good benefits once you have been there for 5 years, vacation time is based on seniority. Able to change department if desired
cons: Management, uncertainty of job, low pay raises, not competitive with other local hospitals. Short staffed on floors and ER, need more experienced nurses
